Column Comment.0: SURFACE ID: unique identifier for the interpreted surface.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: CONFORMITY RELATION: A descriptor assigned to formation picks that identifiesthe type of conformity relationship that describes the surface that was picked. May beunconformity, disconformity, angular unconformity, conformable ro paraconformable.An unconformity is a substantial break or gap in the geologic record wher a rock unitis overlain by another that is not next in stratigraphic succession. Normally impliesuplift or erosion with loss of the previously formed strata.
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.5: ORDINAL SEQUENCE NUMBER: sequence in which this surface occurs in theinterpretation, from surface to base
Column Comment.6: OVERTURNED INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that the strat unit is part of anoverturned section and that the normal sequnce of occurrence is reversed.
Column Comment.7: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.8: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.9: REPEAT STRATIGRAPHIC OCCURRENCE NUMBER: A number identifying theoccurrence of a stratigraphic unit in the interpretation. Used to resolve multipleoccurrences of the same stratigraphic unit within the well section.
Column Comment.10: REPEAT STRATIGRAPHY TYPE: The reason the stratigraphic unit was picked twicein the same interpretation. Usually occurs because of faulting or folding.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.13: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.14: SURFACE NAME: name of the interpreted surface.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
